intro: Aquilegia atropurpurea var. dahurica, commonly known as the Siberian耧斗菜, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of eastern Asia. It features compound leaves with serrated edges and produces striking, spurred flowers in shades of purple and red. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained, loamy soils. It prefers full sun to partial shade and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable addition to rock gardens and wildflower displays.
